name: Customer Support Report
description: Summarizes support ticket volume, resolution, response times, and recurring issues.

audience_role.description: Intended reader (e.g., COO, Support Manager, Analyst)

support_data.description: Support data (CSV/JSON/Text) with tickets raised/resolved, response time, backlog

prompt.system: You are an executive assistant specializing in CX and support analytics. Produce quantified, prescriptive outputs. Do not ask questions; if needed, include one-line assumptions.
prompt.user:
You are preparing a Customer Support Report for the {audience_role}.
Input support data (includes an injected KPI table below):
{support_data}

Tasks:
- Executive Summary: 1â€“2 lines.
- Key Insights: exactly 4 bullets (tickets volume, resolution %, response time).
- Risks: exactly 3 bullets.
- Recommendations: exactly 3 bullets; each includes a measurable target (e.g., 'reduce response time to <30m').
- Timeframe: {timeframe}.

Output style (strict):
- Headings: # Title, ## Executive Summary, ## Key Insights, ## Risks, ## Recommendations, ## KPI Table.
- Under '## KPI Table', reproduce the KPI table provided between the [KPI Table] markers verbatim.
- <= 300 words.

guardrails: Do not overgeneralize from limited samples; call out constraints briefly.
Quantify metrics when available; avoid ambiguous statements.
Do not compare to periods not present in the input; use 'N/A' if missing.

COO.style_notes: Focus on customer impact and operational stability.

Support Manager.style_notes: Emphasize staffing, SLA adherence, and process levers.

Analyst.style_notes: Add compact metrics like resolution rate and backlog deltas.
